text: you don't always have to go far to
experience another culture in fact you
can enter an entire new world in the
comforts of your own home in this video
I'm going to share a few of my favorite
Indian recipes that take me right back
to India with just one bite
the first dish we're gonna make is
called aloo Gobi here's what you'll need
half of the head of the cauliflower 2
potatoes 1 onion 1 tomato half a cup of
cilantro 1 green chilli 3 cloves of
garlic a 1 inch piece of ginger 2 and
1/2 teaspoons of cumin 1/2 a teaspoon of
turmeric 1 teaspoon of chili powder 1
teaspoon of coriander powder 1/2 a
teaspoon of garam masala 1/4 teaspoon of
mango powder coconut or sunflower oil
and salt to taste first you're gonna
chop up the onion and tomato like so
then set them aside then you're gonna
want to chop up the potatoes and
cauliflower as well and fry them up in
some oil until they are a little brown
then set those aside as well and then
you're gonna grind the garlic ginger and
chilies and water just enough that you
need until you get a paste like so then
you're gonna want to heat some oil in
the frying pan along with half a
teaspoon of cumin
once that's heated for about a minute
add your garlic ginger chili paste the
pan and saute for another minute next
add your chopped onions and fry them
until they turn a nice golden brown once
they do add your chopped tomatoes and
mix that up until the tomatoes are nice
and soft in a bowl mix your turmeric
coriander rest of your cumin chili
powder and garam masala with a dash of
water just enough so when you mix it all
up you get a nice thick paste
add this paste to your pan and saut√© on
medium heat for about 2 minutes while
mixing the ingredients add half of the
cilantro leaves mango powder and salt to
taste to the mix mix that up for a
minute and then add your fried potato
and cauliflower and mix all that up as
well once it's all mixed up add 1/3 cup
of water to the mix and bring it all to
a boil once you've done that cover it up
and let it simmer for 10 minutes the
next dish is the famous tikka masala for
the marinade you will need 1 cup of
yogurt 1 tbsp of lemon juice 2 teaspoons
of ground cumin 1 teaspoon of ground
cinnamon 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne pepper
1 teaspoon of pepper 1 tablespoon of
ginger powder and 1 teaspoon of salts 3
boneless chicken breasts cut into
bite-size pieces for long skewers in a
large bowl combine your yogurt lemon
juice 2 teaspoons of cumin cinnamon
cayenne ginger pepper and about a
teaspoon of salt stir it in your chicken
pieces and then cover and let it all sit
in the fridge for 45 minutes to an hour
once your chicken is marinated put the
pieces onto skewers like so once you've
done that cook them up on a grill until
they are fully cooked all the way
through and for the sauce you will need
1 tablespoon of butter 1 clove of garlic
1 teaspoon of cumin 1 teaspoon of
paprika 1 teaspoon of salt 1/8 ounce can
of tomato sauce 1 cup of cream I use
half and half for the sauce you're gonna
melt your butter on a pan and once it's
melted saute garlic until it starts to
golden then add 2 teaspoons of cumin
paprika and 1 teaspoon of salt
stir in the tomato sauce and cream I
used half and half cream cover it and
let it simmer for 10 to 15 minutes then
slide off the chicken into your pot of
goodness stir that around for a bit then
cover and simmer for 15 minutes the last
dish is masala stuffed okra for the
spice mix for these babies you'll need
half a teaspoon of coconut or sunflower
oil 1 teaspoon of red pepper flakes 1
tablespoon of coriander seeds one
teaspoon of cumin seeds one teaspoon of
fennel seeds heat the oil in a small pan
over low heat until it shimmers add all
the spices and fry until the spices turn
slightly darker I didn't have cumin
seeds so I use cumin powder which is
totally fine transfer the spices to a
plate and let them cool down once they
do grind the spices to a fine powder in
a spice or coffee grinder or if you're
like me just use a magic bullet and for
the stuffing you'll need half a small
red onion 1 clove of garlic coconut or
sunflower oil 1/4 teaspoon of turmeric
and salt to taste oh yeah you're gonna
need about 20 to 30 pods of okra fry the
onion and garlic in oil in the pan over
medium heat then you're gonna want to
add in the spice mix turmeric and salt
into the onions next wash the okra and
cut off the stem ends then using a sharp
knife you're gonna make an incision into
the okra starting at the stem end and
stopping just before the point make sure
not to cut all the way through the okra
now it's time to stop vo grass
once you've done that heat some oil in a
pan over medium heat and add the stuffed
okra side by side stuff side facing up
cook them until the bottoms of the okra
are brown then reduce the heat to low
and cover the frying pan venting a
little cook for about 10 minutes until
the okra are tender
